bug.author: jkim711
bug.description:
/kind bug MiniKF install error
[A clear and concise description of what the bug is.] I connected to <denchmark-link:http://10.10.10.10>http://10.10.10.10</denchmark-link> and started the installation but at the final steps the computer CPU usage reaches very high and the PC freezes What did you expect to happen: I expected the MiniKF to install properly Anything else you would like to add: [Miscellaneous information that will assist in solving the issue.]
Windows 10 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/4566866/provision.log>provision.log</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/files/4566872/provision.zip>provision.zip</denchmark-link>
Kubeflow version: (version number can be found at the bottom left corner of the Kubeflow dashboard): kfctl version: (use kfctl version): Kubernetes platform: (e.g. minikube) Kubernetes version: (use kubectl version): OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):

comments.comment: Issue Label Bot is not confident enough to auto-label this issue. See <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-botdata/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> for more details.

Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the labels:
Label Probability
area/jupyter 0.79
Please mark this comment with or to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-botdata/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

Can you please share your VM config and memory usage during the installation process? A brief look at the log file tells me that it might be a memory issue since MiniKF couldn't provision Docker, Minikube and Kubeflow. At line 979 - [INFO] Welcome to the MiniKF Provisioning tool.

About to provision:
* Docker
* Minikube
* Kubeflow
* Rok

This can take up to 30', depending on the quality of your network connection. 2020-05-01T18:21:07.183211-0700 provision.py pid=1688/tid=1688/pytid=139645730629376 cli:137
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
